attribution: Adapted with permission from UCLES, A Level Physics, June 1989, Paper 1, Question 1.
title: The Javelin Thrower

children.value:
A javelin thrower exerts a force on the javelin of 
$\quantity{100}{N}$
 for 
$\quantity{0.3}{s}$
. A javelin weighs 
$\quantity{800}{g}$
. What is the rate of change of the momentum of the javelin?

answer.value:
The correct answer is (c). This can come from 
$\valuedef{F}{\frac{\d p}{\d t}}{}$
 or from working it out long hand using SUVAT, and dividing the change of momentum by the time interval.
